Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Complete Supabase setup with document management system

Major Features Added:
- Full Supabase database integration with 9 tables
- Document upload component with auto-parsing
- Document library with category filtering and search
- Document migration script for bulk uploads
- 9-category document classification system
- Authentication fully configured
- Storage buckets configured

Database Tables:
- profiles (user management with roles)
- clients, projects, tasks, time_logs
- work_documentation
- document_library (9-category system)
- document_categories (seeded)
- project_documents (linking)

New Components:
- src/components/DocumentUpload.tsx - File upload with auto-detection
- src/pages/DocumentsPage.tsx - Documents page with toggle

Updated Components:
- src/App.tsx - Added /documents route
- src/components/Navigation.tsx - Added Documents menu item
- .env - Updated with real Supabase credentials

Migration Tools:
- scripts/migrate-documents.ts - Bulk migration script
- DOCUMENT_MIGRATION_GUIDE.md - Step-by-step instructions

Documentation:
- SETUP_COMPLETE.md - Comprehensive setup guide
- SUPABASE_SETUP_SIMPLE.md - Quick reference
- CLARIFY_SUPABASE.md - Configuration details

SQL Scripts:
- supabase-complete-setup.sql - Full schema
- supabase-setup-fixed.sql - Fixed version
- supabase-cleanup-demo-data.sql - Cleanup script

Features:
- Auto-parse document codes (CFM-XXX-XXX-###)
- Auto-extract versions (Rev ##)
- Auto-categorize based on folder structure
- Role-based access (admin/manager/technician)
- Row Level Security enabled
- Storage access controls

Status: Production ready, all features tested
